lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He also promised a continuation of the labour contract system under which all firms hire workers for a fixed period and pay them according to their own methods, subject only to state-set ceilings for wages and bonuses.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Zhao said there was a deficit in state finances in 1986 because of the sharp fall in world oil prices, the rising cost of foreign exchange earnings through exports, reduced income from customs duties and unreasonably heavy spending.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: China needs to accumulate enormous funds for construction in its initial stage of socialist modernisation and consumption must match the available resources, he said.
